content: also have a look at this video tutorial 11 even if you don t speak japanese starting at 48 30 *the first row of the body are worked in st st but on the pictures it looks like garter stitch * the garter stitch edging is knitted on at the end you will pick up stitch from the bottom of the body for this edging if you prefer you can cast on the body provisionally instead then you don t need to pick up stitches later *my wristwarmers are much too large * when people say that there mitts turned out *much* too large this is sometimes due to the fact that they mixed up the right and the left mitt check the pictures again and see if you are wearing them as in the pictures the fan flap should start in the middle of the palm and go round the little finger it should be buttoned towards the thumb **tip ** ioralochtach 12 had the beautiful idea to tack the edge of the inner layer underneath the flap to the top and this way creating a pocket 13 under the flap that can be opened and closed with the buttons 1 http //www blumenbunt blogspot com/p/die-liebe-zu-den-dahlien html 2 http //www ravelry com/people/blumenbunt 3 https //youtu be/mw9c0lbmwdg si=tgyricvwll-vbebr 4 https //youtu be/ekwesqw8uyi si=b1byemqb_vqm9pmq 5 https //www ravelry com/people/happyfuture 6 http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/spatterdashette 7 http //www ravelry com/people/knittemptress 8 http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/spatterdash-wristwarmers/comments page=2#43 9 https //youtu be/mw9c0lbmwdg si=tgyricvwll-vbebr 10 http //www ravelry com/discuss/fingerless-glove-fanatics/3167807/226-250#239 11 https //youtu be/mw9c0lbmwdg si=tgyricvwll-vbebr 12 https //www ravelry com/people/ioralochtach 13 https //images4-a-cdn ravelrycache com/uploads/ioralochtach/1117641208/img_20260119_101823835_hdr_medium2 jpg webp=0
